title: Digital Electronics
description: Explore foundational concepts in digital electronics including number systems, logic design, and circuit implementation.

subtopics.title: Number Systems
subtopics.description: Covers binary, octal, hexadecimal, BCD, and gray code with conversion techniques and applications.

subtopics.title: Logic Gates
subtopics.description: Introduces basic and compound logic gates including AND, OR, NOT, NAND, NOR, XOR, and XNOR.

subtopics.title: Boolean Algebra
subtopics.description: Teaches simplification techniques and theorems used in logic circuit design.

subtopics.title: Karnaugh Maps (K-Maps)
subtopics.description: Simplifies Boolean expressions using visual K-Map grouping techniques.

subtopics.title: Combinational Circuits
subtopics.description: Focuses on design and analysis of multiplexers, demultiplexers, encoders, decoders, and adders.

subtopics.title: Sequential Circuits
subtopics.description: Explores flip-flops, counters, shift registers, and basic state machines.

subtopics.title: Finite State Machines (FSMs)
subtopics.description: Covers Mealy and Moore state machines, state diagrams, and practical applications.

subtopics.title: Memory and Storage
subtopics.description: Discusses RAM, ROM, EEPROM, and memory hierarchy in digital systems.

subtopics.title: Digital Arithmetic
subtopics.description: Explores binary addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division using logic circuits.

subtopics.title: Programmable Logic Devices (PLDs)
subtopics.description: Introduces FPGA, CPLD, and PLD architectures for custom digital circuit design.

subtopics.title: Analog to Digital and Digital to Analog Conversion (ADC/DAC)
subtopics.description: Explains how digital systems interface with analog signals through ADCs and DACs.

subtopics.title: Introduction to Microcontrollers
subtopics.description: Discusses how microcontrollers integrate digital electronics into embedded systems.
